Opening 5.3/6.0 Project Roots

You can open a 5.3/6.0 project root in the current edition of Serena ChangeMan Version Manager and continue to work with the projects and versioned files contained within it without upgrading to the new format, although some of the functionality is restricted.

If you want complete Version Manager functionality, you must copy your 5.3/6.0 projects into Version Manager project databases.

To open a 5.3/6.0 project root:

  1. Select File | Open Project Database. The Open Project Database dialog box appears.

  2. Browse to the location of the project root you want to open. The location of the project root is the same as the Data File Location of the 5.3/6.0 project in the Version Manager 5.3/6.0 desktop client, and it contains a pvcsproj.pub file. Project databases and 5.3/6.0 project roots appear in the Open Project Database dialog box as a folder with the Version Manager project database icon inside .

  3. Select the 5.3/6.0 project root you want to open and click OK. The project root and folders associated with the project root appear in the Project pane.
